abstract: Texas Rangers shortstop Elvis Andrus and second baseman Ian Kinsler have come to move almost in tandem, as if connected by a rope, in three seasons together; Andrus' flipping of ball to Kinsler to force an out at second base in Game 2 of World Series prevented St Louis Cardinals from staging a possible big inning.
snippet: In three seasons together, shortstop Elvis Andrus and second baseman Ian Kinsler have come to move almost in tandem, as if connected by a rope.
lead_paragraph: In three seasons together, shortstop Elvis Andrus and second baseman Ian Kinsler have come to move almost in tandem, as if connected by a rope.

headline.main: Double-Play Duo Drives Rangers in the Field and Atop the Lineup
headline.print_headline: Double-Play Duo Drives Rangers In the Field and Atop the Lineup
headline.seo: Kinsler and Andrus Drive Rangers at Plate and in Field
